snippet: The technique, in which a gene is injected into the heart to reprogram cells, may one day be an alternative to electronic pacemakers, researchers say.
abstract: Researchers at Cedars-Sinai Heart Institute report that by injecting gene into tiny section of pigs' hearts they were able to temporary reprogram ordinary heart cells into rhythm-generating cells; achievement may eventually lead to alternative to electronic pacemakers in some humans.
lead_paragraph: The technique, in which a gene is injected into the heart to reprogram cells, may one day be an alternative to electronic pacemakers, researchers say.

headline.main: Gene Therapy Is Used to Adjust Pigs’ Heartbeat
headline.print_headline: Work Regulating Heart of Pig May Aid Humans
